member.name: T:NBarCodes.BarCode
member.summary: Base class for barcodes. Defines common functionality.
member.remarks: This is the base class for creating barcodes, it defines common functionality like bar measures, text position and colors.

member.name: P:NBarCodes.BarCode.OffsetWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin offset width.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the margin offset width of the barcode. The side of the barcode (left or right) for which the margin offset width affects depends on the particular barcode implementation.

member.name: P:NBarCodes.BarCode.OffsetHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin offset height.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the margin offset height of the barcode. The side of the barcode (top or bottom) for which the margin offset height affects depends on the particular barcode implementation.

member.name: T:NBarCodes.IChecksum
member.summary: Interface to calculate checksums on barcode data.
member.remarks: Classes that calculate checksums on barcode data should implement this interface. It makes for a pluggable checksum architecture.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.IChecksum.Calculate(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates the checksum of a string of data.
member.param: The data to calculate the checksum for.

member.name: T:NBarCodes.ISymbolEncoder
member.summary: Encoder interface for barcode symbols.
member.remarks: Classes that encode barcode data into arrays of bits () should implement this interface.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.ISymbolEncoder.Encode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a string of barcode data.
member.param: The string of data to be encoded.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.ISymbolEncoder.Encode(System.Char)
member.summary: Encodes a character of barcode data.
member.param: The character of data to be encoded.

member.name: T:NBarCodes.IOptionalChecksum
member.summary: Determines whether the checksum calculation in a barcode is optional.

member.name: P:NBarCodes.IOptionalChecksum.UseChecksum
member.summary: Determines whether the barcode will calculate a checksum on its data.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.Code39.CalculateExtraWidth(System.Collections.BitArray[])
member.summary: Calculates the extra width rendered with the space padding.

member.name: T:NBarCodes.TableEncoder
member.summary: Encoder base class for table-lookup like encoders.

member.summary: Looks up the sought value and returns its encoded equivalent. Should be properly overriden in derived classes.
member.param: Index of the value to look up.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.TableEncoder.Encode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a string of barcode data.
member.param: The string of data to be encoded.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.TableEncoder.Encode(System.Char)
member.summary: Encodes a character of barcode data.
member.remarks: This method uses the method to resolve the character of data to an encoded entity (). It assumes the datum passed represents a number and converts it before looking it up.
member.param: The character of data to be encoded.

member.name: F:NBarCodes.Code39Translator.mapping
member.summary: Mapping for all ascii codes less than 128.

member.name: T:NBarCodes.TextPosition
member.summary: Enumeration to position string elements in barcodes.
member.remarks: This enumeration positions string elements in barcodes. It has a Flags () attribute to allow for more than one option (through bitwise or).

member.name: F:NBarCodes.TextPosition.None
member.summary: The text won't appear in the rendered barcode.

member.name: F:NBarCodes.TextPosition.Top
member.summary: The text will be rendered on top of the barcode.

member.name: F:NBarCodes.TextPosition.Bottom
member.summary: The text will be rendered on the bottom of the barcode.

member.name: F:NBarCodes.TextPosition.All
member.summary: The text will be rendered on top and on the bottom of the barcode.

member.name: T:NBarCodes.Modulo10Checksum
member.summary: implementation that calculates a modulo 10 checksum based on EAN-type or 2-of-5-type barcode checksums.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.Modulo10Checksum.Calculate(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates a modulo 10 checksum on the input data.

remarks.para: This checksum digit calculation is based on a modulo 10 calculation of the weighted sum of the values of each of the digits of the input data.

First, we take the rightmost digit of the value and consider it to be an "even" character. We then move right-to-left, alternating between even and odd. We then sum the numeric value of all the odd positions, and sum the numeric value multiplied by three of all the even positions. The check digit, then, is the number which, when added to the total calculated, results in a number evenly divisible by 10. If the sum is already evenly divisible by 10, the check digit is "0".

member.param: The data of which to calculate the checksum.

member.name: M:NBarCodes.Modulo10Checksum.AssertOnlyDigits(System.String)
member.summary: Asserts that the data consists only of digits.

Documentation.summary: A control to generate bar codes.

remarks.para: This control generates bar codes in a web page. It can generate any bar code of a set of bar code types as images, and it has many layout and behavior attributes.
This control needs a special http handler to be registered with the application in order to work properly. This is an example for the relevant section in the web.config file that needs to be added:

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class. Will validate the license of the control.

member.summary: Render this control to the output parameter specified.
member.param: The HTML writer to write out to.
